abalone_prediction.modeling module

Binary classification of the abalones to predict their age. (0:less than 15 years, 1:equal/more)

Dataset

“../data/abalone.data”, 4177 observations, 9 features.

ML Model used

Random Forest Classification (bad precision)

Context

Predicting the age of abalone from physical measurements. The age of abalone is determined by cutting the shell through the cone, staining it, and counting the number of rings through a microscope – a boring and time-consuming task. Other measurements, which are easier to obtain, are used to predict the age.

Features

  • sex / nominal / – / M, F, and I (infant)

  • Length / continuous / mm / Longest shell measurement

  • Diameter / continuous / mm / perpendicular to length

  • Height / continuous / mm / with meat in shell

  • Whole weight / continuous / grams / whole abalone

  • Shucked weight / continuous / grams / weight of meat

  • Viscera weight / continuous / grams / gut weight (after bleeding)

  • Shell weight / continuous / grams / after being dried

  • Rings / integer / – / +1.5 gives the age in years

Target feature : ring of the abalone

‘target’ (based on ‘rings’ feature) :

  • 0 : less than 10 rings ( < 15 years)

  • 1 : more than 10 rings ( >= 15 years)

abalone_prediction.modeling.dummy_encode(in_df)

Encoding categorical features; here ‘sex’ of the abalone. Male (1,0,0), Female(0,1,0) and Infant(0,0,1).

Parameters

in_df (pandas.DataFrame) – X_train (or X_test).

Returns

out_df: X_train (or X_test) processed.

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

abalone_prediction.modeling.load_data_abalone(path)

Load abalone data into a panda dataframe then transform the feature ‘rings’ (int) into ‘target’ (int).

Parameters

path (str) – Path of the abalone dataset.

Returns

df: The dataset of the experience with feature ‘rings’ transformed into ‘target’ feature.

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

abalone_prediction.modeling.load_model(path)

Load the ML model store at the path

Parameters

path (str) – Path of the model stored

abalone_prediction.modeling.minmax_scale(in_df)

Rescaling numerical features based on their boundaries.

Parameters

in_df (pandas.DataFrame) – X_train (or X_test).

Returns

out_df: X_train (or X_test) processed.

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

abalone_prediction.modeling.predict_abalone(abalone, model)

Return the label and the probability for one abalone.

Parameters

  • abalone (dict/list) – dictionary such as ‘{“val1”:val1, “val2”:val2}’ or a list such as ‘[val1, val2]’. The dict of the list can have more than two items.

  • model (sklearn) – sklearn model.

Returns

abalone_predict: Dictionary where “label” and “proba” are the keys. {“label”: label, “proba”: proba}

Return type

dict

abalone_prediction.modeling.preprocessing_data(data)

Get ‘X_train’ and ‘X_test’ from ‘data’(dict), apply one-hot encoding and rescaling on them then return the dict with X_train and X_test processed.

Parameters

data (dict) – Dictionary structured as: {“X_train”: X_train, “X_test”: X_test, “y_train”: y_train, “y_test”: y_test}

Returns

data: The same dictionary on the input with X_train and X_test pre-processed.

Return type

dict

abalone_prediction.modeling.print_roc_auc(model, data)

Print the ML ROC AUC score

Parameters

  • model (sklearn.RandomForestClassifier) – ML model

  • data (dict) – Dictionary structured as : {“X_train”: X_train, “X_test”: X_test, “y_train”: y_train, “y_test”: y_test}

abalone_prediction.modeling.split_data(df, test_size=0.33, seed=42)

Split the dataframe into test and train data.

Parameters

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – The dataset of the experience.

  • test_size (float/int) – Proportion of the dataset to include to the test set.

  • seed (int) – Value to have reproducible results.

Returns

data : Dictionary structured as: {“X_train”: X_train, “X_test”: X_test, “y_train”: y_train, “y_test”: y_test}

Return type

dict

abalone_prediction.modeling.store_model(model, path)

Store the ML model store at the path

Parameters

  • model (sklearn) – ML model to store

  • path (str) – Path of the model stored

abalone_prediction.modeling.train_model(data)

Train and return the model.

Parameters

data (dict) – Dictionary structured as: {“X_train”: X_train, “X_test”: X_test, “y_train”: y_train, “y_test”: y_test}

Returns

model: Random Forest model trained.

Return type

sklearn.RandomForestClassifier
